issue.title: Assasins creed 2 / AC:Brotherhood
issue.body:
Massive camera shaking and at irregular rate.Like twitching. In some view directions its much less in amplitude and severe in other directions.No settings / resolution/Vsync off or on helps.
I use DXVK with reshade but even without it, same problem remains.
Here is the issue on video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZtqvrBByEZo

If you use Windows, please check the following page: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Windows

### Software information
Name of the game, settings used etc.

### System information
- GPU:3080 Ti Asus Tuf
- Driver: 531.68
- Wine version: 
- DXVK version: 2.2

### Apitrace file(s)
- (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-CrW1oDiP-2d1pRAlgtCuloaN8ZtJqRr/view?usp=drive_link)

This Apitrace is gathered from couple of minutes of play from AC:brotherhood

For instructions on how to use apitrace, see: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Using-Apitrace

### Log files
Please attach Proton or Wine logs as a text file:
- When using Proton, set the Steam launch options for your game to `PROTON_LOG=1 %command%` and attach the corresponding `steam-xxxxx.log` file in your home directory.
- When using regular Wine, use `wine game.exe > game.log 2>&1` and attach the resulting `game.log` file.

comment.body:
I have the same issue on Brotherhood. Setting .exe affinity to 1 core only seems to fix most of the camera issues but Ezio still moves a bit weird, so the problem looks to be CPU related.
These games have notorious problems with multi-core CPUs on Windows even without dxvk:
https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Assassin%27s_Creed:_Brotherhood#In-game_stuttering.2C_freezing_issues

Found on some old forums that disabling CPU hyperthreding on BIOS made the games run better, but it does not fix this dxvk issue. I use a Ryzen 7 5700x (8C/16T).

not sure if any of this helps but it's what I found out.

comment.body: Game completely shutsdown(no errors etc) while alt-tabbing or ctrl+alt+del , so i cant test the threads and cores. (i got 16 gigs of ram | 2x8 )

issue.title: New World - Failed to create buffer view and crashing
issue.body:
So ever since the New World Call of the Wilds DLC update i've been having some nasty consistent crashes at around the 1 hour mark. The most noticeable crash is the game picture stops updating and then i get disconnected from the game, however the game does not crash even after waiting 10min. I've tried to look at the Proton Logs but i cant find anything among the millions of lines... I did however grep for `err:`, `warn:` and `info:` lines and found these DXVK errors at the bottom of the log It always starts with ``` D3D11: Cannot create texture ``` Then these ``` DxvkBufferView: Failed to create buffer view ``` Today i got a different error message but in the same ball park ``` DxvkImageView: Failed to create image view ``` So i wonder, is this a error message for the DXVK devs or the game devs that a texture is broken? This is what i've tried: - I've tested both x11 and Wayland - I've tested both KDE and Gnome - I've tested Proton Experimental, GE-Proton 8-20 and Proton 8.0-4 - I've tested DX11 and DX12 - I've tested a bunch of launch options - I've reset the ShaderCache in steamapps/shadercache/1063730/DXVK_state_cache/ - I've checked that i'm not running out of VRAM - I've deleted `SteamLibrary/steamapps/compatdata/1063730/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/AppData/*/AGS` as someone suggested for crashes - I've "Deleted all data and applications inside this wineprefix" via ProtonTricks - I've installed d3dcompiler_43 via ProtonTricks - I've installed d3dcompiler_47 via ProtonTricks (Fixes fixme:d3dcompiler:skip_u32_unknown in the logs) - I've installed dxvk via ProtonTricks - I've reinstalled New World from scratch - I've removed Mangohud and Gamemode from launch options - PROTON_USE_WINED3D=1 makes it "The computer fails to meet one or more of the minimum specifications in order to run" because its 1280 MB VRAM by default. Workaround to set VideoMemorySize to 11GB in Registry, however the rendering is messed up and not worth it. - I've tested vkd3d-proton via Protontricks - I've tested nvidia-open The ONE thing that DID work is to play differently in one old area, the log file was calm and i did not crash for 2.5 hours. Which probably indicates a issue with a texture? ### Software information New World on any settings. ### System information
Click for System information
- Operating System: Arch Linux - KDE Plasma Version: 5.27.9 - KDE Frameworks Version: 5.111.0 - Qt Version: 5.15.11 - Kernel Version: 6.5.8-arch1-1 (64-bit) - Graphics Platform: X11 - Processors: 32 × AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-Core Processor - Memory: 31.3 GiB of RAM - Graphics Processor: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Ti/PCIe/SSE2 - Manufacturer: ASUS
- GPU: Nvidia 3080 ti - Driver: Proprietary and Open-Source kernel 535.113.01 - Wine version: Proton 7.0-6, 8.0-4 and GE-Proton 8-20 - DXVK version: No clue ### Apitrace file(s) - Put a link here For instructions on how to use apitrace, see: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Using-Apitrace ### Log files The logs are TOO DAMN BIG (50mill lines and 5GB in 1 hour. Most of the log is flodded with these ``` 9644.436:0134:0374:trace:unwind:dump_unwind_info 0xa: pushq %rdi ``` [steam-1063730-err.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182654/steam-1063730-err.log) [steam-1063730-info.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182655/steam-1063730-info.log) [steam-1063730-err2.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182669/steam-1063730-err2.log) I currently have a 1.2GiB crash log file i can grep if anyone have something i can search for

comment.body:
> I've tested DX11 and DX12

Does the game support dx12?

> I currently have a 1.2GiB crash log file i can grep if anyone have something i can search for

The log should compress very well.
Alternatively you can run with `PROTON_LOG=-unwind`

comment.body:
So to be specific, one day i decided to farm trees in Everfall while testing a change and waiting for the crash, in those 2 hours the highest place i went to was Myrkgard. 
The places i constantly crash in seems to be in elite zones in Brimstone and Elysium (new zone) and newer dungeons (might be Corrupted related)

comment.body: Plus I'm not going say this was an overlook on ubisoft's view. If steam deck had the correct amount of threads and cores for the game to run. Then this is an issue on system spec on GPU/ CPU shadering issues with the game when using DXVK. Also I haven't asked about Ram.

issue.title: DXVK treats fullscreen borderless and fullscreen the same under Windows
issue.body:
DXVK has no issues with windowed borderless mode, but fullscreen borderless is incorrectly treated as if it's fullscreen in DXVK. I have read the windows page and understand this might have been done to avoid issues with exclusive fullscreen, but this behavior is very annoying to deal with because you get a blackscreen when you switch from game to screen and vice versa.

If you use Windows, please check the following page: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Windows

### Software information
Any games that use fullscreen borderless mode

### System information
- GPU: Intel ARC A770 LE
- Driver: 31.0.101.4257
- Wine version: N/A
- DXVK version: Tested 2.0/2.1, likely affects other versions as well

### Apitrace file(s)
N/A
For instructions on how to use apitrace, see: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Using-Apitrace

### Log files
N/A

comment.body: @mirh I have a 4k 27" display so running at 150% scaling, is that a non-standard factor thought?

comment.body:
> Let us know if it is fixed.

Thanks for trying but no. It doesnt fix it at all.
So i used the CRU , Changed the 1080p(thats what im using ingame too) resolution refreshrate to 50 then the actual monitor frequency from properties 
![image](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/assets/131720816/886cf521-8676-4fef-8ddc-5ff4e3704e23)
Checked the games res (it was on 59hz) changed to 50hz and i tried vsync on and off.
No change
What is weird to me is no one can discern even where the problem is from one (significant?) clue. The shaking is NOT the same in all view directions. Looking down has alot less.

forkee.name: dxvk
forkee.description: Vulkan-based implementation of D3D9, D3D10 and D3D11 for Linux / Wine

issue.title: Assassin's Creed 1 through Revelations bouncing image issue
issue.body:
When using DXVK with Assassin's Creed 1 to Revelations, the image bounces around. 2D elements are fine, but anything 3D goes nuts. Tried some setting in the config, but couldn't find one that worked.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84683672/130040661-3ce0321e-fa8c-462d-bd55-0046ee92f0a6.mp4

Log file:
[ACRSP_d3d9.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/7013141/ACRSP_d3d9.log)

comment.body: #3546 I have found out what the bug was.

comment.body:
> > Note that this is a game bug that can get triggered somehow and neither I nor the devs have ever been able to reproduce it. [#2249 (comment)](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/issues/2249#issuecomment-1195559553) Also see for one of the bit later games https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/assassins-creed-revelations/connectivity-and-performance/article/flickering-or-shaky-camera-on-windows-10-in-assassins-creed-revelations/000063457
> > Will try again on my new setup tho
> 
> I can agree on this as I looked it up on PCGAMINGWIKI website. https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Assassin%27s_Creed_II#Stuttering.2FTearing_with_Vsync_On_or_Off This is a bug not related to DXVK. @DarkoP913 what is your CPU, your monitor's refresh rate, and are you playing with a controller? Cause this is a bug from Ubisoft's "bugged" testing on 50hz.

Cpu: i7 6700k. I had this same problem on my previous intel g4560
Monitor is 60hz but i had locked max fps on 58 fps(dont ask why) . 
Yesterday i tried to retest if its the nvidia controlpanel settings Vsync-wise , but the same problem remains. yes i even changed the max fps to 60 to eliminate variables.
Now i rechecked vsync off or on, no change.Both from nvidia control panel (global settings) and from within the game.

Never used a controler,always keyboard and mouse

So ever since the New World Call of the Wilds DLC update i've been having some nasty consistent crashes at around the 1 hour mark. I've tried to look at the Proton Logs but i cant find anything among the millions of lines... I did however grep for `err:`, `warn:` and `info:` lines and found these DXVK errors at the bottom of the log It always starts with ``` D3D11: Cannot create texture ``` Then these ``` DxvkBufferView: Failed to create buffer view ``` Today i got a different error message but in the same ball park ``` DxvkImageView: Failed to create image view ``` So i wonder, is this a error message for the DXVK devs or the game devs that a texture is broken? This is what i've tried: - I've tested both x11 and Wayland - I've tested both KDE and Gnome - I've tested Proton Experimental, GE-Proton 8-20 and Proton 8.0-4 - I've tested DX11 and DX12 - I've tested a bunch of launch options - I've reset the ShaderCache in steamapps/shadercache/1063730/DXVK_state_cache/ - I've checked that i'm not running out of VRAM - I've deleted `SteamLibrary/steamapps/compatdata/1063730/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/AppData/*/AGS` as someone suggested for crashes - I've "Deleted all data and applications inside this wineprefix" via ProtonTricks - I've installed d3dcompiler_43 via ProtonTricks - I've installed d3dcompiler_47 via ProtonTricks (Fixes fixme:d3dcompiler:skip_u32_unknown in the logs) - I've installed dxvk via ProtonTricks - I've reinstalled New World from scratch - I've removed Mangohud and Gamemode from launch options - PROTON_USE_WINED3D=1 makes it "The computer fails to meet one or more of the minimum specifications in order to run" because its 1280 MB VRAM by default. Workaround to set VideoMemorySize to 11GB in Registry, however the rendering is messed up and not worth it. - I've tested vkd3d-proton via Protontricks - I've tested nvidia-open The ONE thing that DID work is to play differently in one old area, the log file was calm and i did not crash for 2.5 hours. Which probably indicates a issue with a texture? ### Software information New World on any settings. ### System information
Click for System information
- Operating System: Arch Linux - KDE Plasma Version: 5.27.9 - KDE Frameworks Version: 5.111.0 - Qt Version: 5.15.11 - Kernel Version: 6.5.8-arch1-1 (64-bit) - Graphics Platform: X11 - Processors: 32 × AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-Core Processor - Memory: 31.3 GiB of RAM - Graphics Processor: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Ti/PCIe/SSE2 - Manufacturer: ASUS
- GPU: Nvidia 3080 ti - Driver: Proprietary and Open-Source kernel 535.113.01 - Wine version: Proton 7.0-6, 8.0-4 and GE-Proton 8-20 - DXVK version: No clue ### Apitrace file(s) - Put a link here For instructions on how to use apitrace, see: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Using-Apitrace ### Log files The logs are TOO DAMN BIG (50mill lines and 5GB in 1 hour. Most of the log is flodded with these ``` 9644.436:0134:0374:trace:unwind:dump_unwind_info 0xa: pushq %rdi ``` [steam-1063730-err.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182654/steam-1063730-err.log) [steam-1063730-info.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182655/steam-1063730-info.log) [steam-1063730-err2.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182669/steam-1063730-err2.log) I currently have a 1.2GiB crash log file i can grep if anyone have something i can search for

comment.body: Could you elaborate on how "to play differently in one old area"? It seems rather crucial so a detailed description might give a hint to troubleshoot with

issue.title: New World - Failed to create buffer view and crashing
issue.body:
So ever since the New World Call of the Wilds DLC update i've been having some nasty consistent crashes at around the 1 hour mark. The most noticeable crash is the game picture stops updating and then i get disconnected from the game, however the game does not crash even after waiting 10min. I've tried to look at the Proton Logs but i cant find anything among the millions of lines... I did however grep for `err:`, `warn:` and `info:` lines and found these DXVK errors at the bottom of the log It always starts with ``` D3D11: Cannot create texture ``` Then these ``` DxvkBufferView: Failed to create buffer view ``` Today i got a different error message but in the same ball park ``` DxvkImageView: Failed to create image view ``` So i wonder, is this a error message for the DXVK devs or the game devs that a texture is broken? This is what i've tried: - I've tested both x11 and Wayland - I've tested both KDE and Gnome - I've tested Proton Experimental, GE-Proton 8-20 and Proton 8.0-4 - I've tested DX11 and DX12 - I've tested a bunch of launch options - I've reset the ShaderCache in steamapps/shadercache/1063730/DXVK_state_cache/ - I've checked that i'm not running out of VRAM - I've deleted `SteamLibrary/steamapps/compatdata/1063730/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/AppData/*/AGS` as someone suggested for crashes - I've "Deleted all data and applications inside this wineprefix" via ProtonTricks - I've installed d3dcompiler_43 via ProtonTricks - I've installed d3dcompiler_47 via ProtonTricks (Fixes fixme:d3dcompiler:skip_u32_unknown in the logs) - I've installed dxvk via ProtonTricks - I've reinstalled New World from scratch - I've removed Mangohud and Gamemode from launch options - PROTON_USE_WINED3D=1 makes it "The computer fails to meet one or more of the minimum specifications in order to run" because its 1280 MB VRAM by default. Workaround to set VideoMemorySize to 11GB in Registry, however the rendering is messed up and not worth it. - I've tested vkd3d-proton via Protontricks - I've tested nvidia-open The ONE thing that DID work is to play differently in one old area, the log file was calm and i did not crash for 2.5 hours. Which probably indicates a issue with a texture? ### Software information New World on any settings. ### System information
Click for System information
- Operating System: Arch Linux - KDE Plasma Version: 5.27.9 - KDE Frameworks Version: 5.111.0 - Qt Version: 5.15.11 - Kernel Version: 6.5.8-arch1-1 (64-bit) - Graphics Platform: X11 - Processors: 32 × AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-Core Processor - Memory: 31.3 GiB of RAM - Graphics Processor: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Ti/PCIe/SSE2 - Manufacturer: ASUS

Most of the log is flodded with these ``` 9644.436:0134:0374:trace:unwind:dump_unwind_info 0xa: pushq %rdi ``` [steam-1063730-err.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182654/steam-1063730-err.log) [steam-1063730-info.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182655/steam-1063730-info.log) [steam-1063730-err2.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13182669/steam-1063730-err2.log) I currently have a 1.2GiB crash log file i can grep if anyone have something i can search for

issue.title: [dxd9] Saints row 2 stuttering, freezes while using dxvk 2.1 on an AMD gpu. Trying dxvk x32, x64 and qinilili's patch.
issue.body:
After playing the game with the x32 version of dxvk after a minute or so, the game freezes and forces me to restart my pc. The game also sometimes crashes when i load the game (seems to be fixed by running the game through the .exe file instead of steam). When i replace dxvk x32 with the x64 version, the overall performance seems to be better, stutters are gone, still get minor frame drops (from 70 fps to 50), but after a while the game gets enormous frame drops (<1 fps) and im forced to quit the game. The dxvk patch works perfectly on my brothers pc even though its specs are worse than mine. (has an nvidia gpu, think i heard that amd gpus have bad performance on older games?)
Tried [qinlili23333]'s sr2 patch that is supposed to fix the games memory management. The game runs nearly perfectly (stable 50 fps, odd stutter here and there), but i get a constant flickering bar at the bottom of my screen. (Fixed by enabling fullscreen vsync). Combining the .exe patch and dxvk makes the game run worse than vanilla.
So, as of now qinlili's patch without dxvk runs the best for me, but i hope that someday dxvk will work for me and i would be able to run the game perfectly at a stable 60 fps. Btw the game's api is x32, so it seems strange to me that the x64 patch of dxvk runs better than the x32 for me. I will attach the games log files from every different version/patch i tested. Hope this post helps development or helps someone else get better performance in-game. Next, i will test DXVK-Async's and DxWrapper's effect on the performance. Will update if i find something worthwhile.
[dxvk32nopatch.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/11301207/dxvk32nopatch.log)
[dxvkx64nopatch.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/11301208/dxvkx64nopatch.log)
[x32crashonloadgame.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/11301209/x32crashonloadgame.log)
[nodxvk_patchedexe.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/11301210/nodxvk_patchedexe.log)

comment.body: No problem.

issue.title: DXVK treats fullscreen borderless and fullscreen the same under Windows
issue.body:
DXVK has no issues with windowed borderless mode, but fullscreen borderless is incorrectly treated as if it's fullscreen in DXVK. I have read the windows page and understand this might have been done to avoid issues with exclusive fullscreen, but this behavior is very annoying to deal with because you get a blackscreen when you switch from game to screen and vice versa.

If you use Windows, please check the following page: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Windows

### Software information
Any games that use fullscreen borderless mode

### System information
- GPU: Intel ARC A770 LE
- Driver: 31.0.101.4257
- Wine version: N/A
- DXVK version: Tested 2.0/2.1, likely affects other versions as well

### Apitrace file(s)
N/A
For instructions on how to use apitrace, see: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/wiki/Using-Apitrace

### Log files
N/A

comment.body: Do you have non-standard scaling factors too? If yes this might be similar to https://github.com/RPCS3/rpcs3/issues/14180

This is because of LAA was need but Steam prevents this cause of Steam's stub protection. Steam: Use this instead: https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/issues/2417#issuecomment-1145601491 
Gog: use the LAA Patch.

issue.title: [d3d11] - Red Faction Guerrilla Re-Mars-tered (667720) - Graphical aberrations are present when looking at the skybox.
issue.body:
Large black circles are visible in-game (incorrectly rendered lens flare?) upon looking up at the sky box in all outdoor areas of the game. Issue  can also be reproduced on Steam Deck, but is not present on Windows or WineD3D


|DXVK|WineD3D|
| ---- | ---- |
|![DXVK](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/assets/761853/a72ff207-4804-4492-84f7-7f1f1037ccc7)|![WineD3D](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/assets/761853/be3d1c43-1893-4677-9d97-2a7d2608b050)|

### Software information
[Red Faction Guerrilla Re-Mars-tered (667720)](https://store.steampowered.com/app/667720/Red_Faction_Guerrilla_ReMarstered/)

### System information
- GPU: RX 6800 / Steam Deck
- Driver: Mesa 23.3.0-devel ([16e1163651](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/mesa/mesa/-/commit/16e1163651)) / SteamOS 3.5.1
- Wine version: Proton 8.0-4b
- DXVK version: DXVK-git ([f45911a](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/commit/f45911a28f6e6184f82487e983b4a6af6923e61c)) / v2.3-5-g83dc4678df76578

### Apitrace file(s)
- Title launches directly to a crash reporter when attempting to trace on Linux or Windows.

### Log files
Link: [steam-667720.log](https://github.com/doitsujin/dxvk/files/13110195/steam-667720.log)

comment.body:
Can confirm the issue. Tested with both amdvlk and radv and a regression test back to dxvk 0.7, but was the same. Haven't found any configs to affect it either.
Can't get apitrace working either and the game crashes with validation layers.
